children.value: When using e2e testing in my work, we faced the issue of a lot of code being duplicated. To solve this problem, we defined a dedicated new design pattern for e2e test.
Before start, I would inform you that our company is using two different concept of components:
When using e2e testing in my work, we faced the issue of a lot of code being duplicated. To solve this problem, we defined a dedicated new design pattern for e2e test.
Before start, I would inform you that our company is using two different concept of components:

props.code:
project
├── components/
│   ├── Button.ts
│   ├── Menu.ts
│   ├── PasswordInput.ts
│   └── EmailInput.ts
├── modules/
│   ├── Navbar/
│   │   ├── Navbar.vue
│   │   └── Navbar.e2e.model.ts
│   └── SubmitForm/
│       ├── SubmitForm.vue
│       └── SubmitForm.e2e.model.ts
├── e2e/
    ...

├── e2e/

is a set of multiple components and it takes in charge of a feature of your app such as
. You might noticed that each module has own
file being used in our e2e test.
for e2e test. It defines the functions that we gonna test in e2e test, so
it's only imported in e2e test file, not in your app
. However we decided to leave model file together with module so that we don't need to switching folder between e2e and modules to make a spec of the model of module.
Here is a simple example of navbar model file.
Here is e2e test folder structure of our app. The important thing here is to understand what a

project
├── e2e/
│   ├── assets/
│   ├── models/

│   │   └── navigation.model.ts
│   ├── scenarios/

children.value:
project
├── e2e/
│   ├── assets/
│   ├── models/
│   │   ├── index.model.ts
│   │   └── navigation.model.ts
│   ├── scenarios/
│   │   ├── user-login.scenario.ts
│   │   └── buy-product.scenario.ts
│   ├── tests/
│   │   └── user-buy-product.e2e.spec.ts
│   ├── types.ts
│   └── utils
e2e related assets such as uploading image, pdf, etc.
As explained above, Model is a specification of module. This folder has
which will import all models under
We can also create some useful model for e2e test under
folder. For example, our project has
. Highly recommended to create more model if you think some codes are used in many places of e2e test.
Scenario is a file where we write the scenario we want to test. Simply put, a scenario can be thought of as a set of models.

The test file refers to a file that defines what we ultimately want to test. There may be one or multiple scenarios in a test file. You can also include model if scenario doesn't cover specific case of your test.
